contact.text: Brocade Communications Systems, Inc. Postal: 130 Holger Way San Jose, CA 95134 U.S.A Tel: +1-408-333-8000 E-mail: support@Brocade.com web: www.brocade.com.

description.text: This management module is an extension to the port-profile model for - Defining RPCs to retrieve port-profile related operational data in the managed device.
Initial version of the management module port-profile-ext
This is a function that returns the port profiles applied on port(s) and port-channels.
rbridge id of the node from which the data needs to be fetched. When no rbridge id is given, data is fetched from all rbridges

This indicates the name and type of the interface to query. The rpc response contians the list of port-profiles applied on the given interface.
The rpc request would look as below: get-port-profile-for-intf interface-type=fortygigabitethernet interface-name=1/0/1.
The rpc response contains the list of port-profiles applied on the interface fo 1/0/1.
The rpc response has an attribute has-more, which will always be false, since the rpc response contains all the port-profiles applied on the given interface.
This indicates the name and type of the last interface, for which the list of applied port-profiles is already received.

The rpc returns the list of port-profiles associated with the next set of interfaces.
The rpc request would look as below: get-port-profile-for-intf last-received-interface-info/interface-type= fortygigabitethernet last-received-interface-info/interface-name= 1/0/1.
The rpc response will contain the list of port-profiles applied on the interface fo 1/0/2, 1/0/3 and so on till the page limit is reached.
The rpc response has an attribute is-more, which will be false, when all the interfaces are exhausted.
The getnext-request model can be used to retrieve the port-profiles applied on all the interfaces.
The rpc returns the list of port-profiles applied on the first set of interfaces when interface name and interface type are not specified.
The list of all the interfaces on which Port Profile is applied. Each row represents interface details(type,name) and the Port Profile name applied on the interface.
The list of port profiles applied on this interface. Each row contains Port Profile name.
This indicates Port Profile name associated to this interface.

Value is :
false, for get request model. false, when the port-profiled-ports are exhausted in getnext request model.
true, when more port-profiled ports exist in getnext request model.
This is a function that returns the status of a port profile or all the port profiles.
rbridge id of the node from which the data needs to be fetched. When no rbridge id is given, data is fetched from all rbridges
This indicates the optional port profile name to query.It returns status of all profiles if no profile name is specified
Port Profile is activated.
Port Profile is associated to one or more MAC addresses.
Port Profile is applied on one or more interfaces.
This indicates query is based on the port profile status. Profiles are not filtered based on the status when this parameter is not specified
This indicates the name of the last received port-profile.
This indicates the last received mac address of the last received port-profile.

get request : provides data only for a given port profile based on the input attribute port-profile-name.
To begin with, user should provide port-profile-name attribute and optional profile-mac value as 00:00:00:00:00:00. The response will contain the initial set of macs associated with the given port profile.
For subsequent calls, user should provide port-profile-name along with the profile-mac value. Response will contain the next set of associated macs for the given port profile.
Response has an attribute is-more, which will be false, when all the macs associated with a given port-profile are exhausted.
getnext request : To get the next record, provide both profile-name and profile-mac.
To begin with, user can invoke the rpc without providing profile-name and profile-mac attributes. The response will contain the initial set of macs associated with the first port profile.
For subsequent calls, user should provide profile-name along with the profile-mac.
If the user provides profile-name and last profile mac associated with the profile, the response will contain the next port profile info.
Response has an attribute is-more, which will be false, when all the macs associated with all the port-profiles are exhausted.
The list of port profiles. Each row represents the port profile details, its status and its MAC associations.
This indicates the name of the port profile.
This indicates the id of the Port Profile.
This indicates if this port-profile is activated or not.
The list of MAC associations for this port profile. Each row represents the MAC address and the details of the interface to which the MAC is associated.
This indicates the MAC addresses associated with this Port Profile.

This container provides the grouping of elements required to identify the interface on which which this MAC association is applied. No interface name will be listed when the port profile is not applied with respect to this MAC.

Value is : false, if no more macs exist for a given port-profile in get request model or no more macs exist for the last profile in getnext request model.
true, if more macs exist for a given profile in get request model or more macs [or profiles] exist in getnext request model.
